benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/tags - Retrieve payment tags

covered: Valid Request: Multiple happy-path scenarios validate successful retrieval (no query params, includedDeleted, pluginProperty, audit variants, combined params).
Empty Response: TC06 covers the case where a payment exists but has no tags (empty JSON array).
Query Parameters: Positive and negative tests for includedDeleted, pluginProperty, audit (including invalid audit value) and extra/unexpected params are present.
Authorization: Missing token scenario (TC09) verifies authentication failure (401).
Error Scenarios: 400 for invalid paymentId format (TC08), 404 for non-existent payment (TC07/TC20), 500 (TC24), 503 for dependency outage (TC13) are included.
Security: SQL injection and XSS attempts are tested (TC15, TC16).
Performance & Load: Responses under heavy load and large result sets are addressed (TC12, TC18).
Edge cases & Limits: Maximum pluginProperty entries and large payloads are covered (TC17, TC18).
Resilience & Recovery: Retry on transient network failure covered (TC21).
Regression & Compatibility: Regression for deleted-tags inclusion and backward compatibility tests included (TC14, TC22).
Accessibility & Schema: Accessibility and response structure well-formed check (TC23) and Content-Type validated (TC01)
gaps: Pagination: No tests exercise pagination behavior or query params for paging (limit/offset/page) or server-side pagination headers.
Caching Behavior: No tests check caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control), conditional GET behavior (If-None-Match -> 304), or cache invalidation.
Rate Limiting & Throttling: No scenarios validate rate limiting, request throttling or proper 429 responses.
Authorization (Forbidden): No negative test for insufficient permissions (403) — Background assumes permission but no explicit test for forbidden access.
Tag Schema Validation: Tests assert "Tag objects" at a high level but do not validate required fields, types, or full Tag schema conformity per the API definition.
Plugin behavior negative cases: No tests for pluginProperty when plugins are unsupported, when pluginProperty keys are malformed, or when plugin processing fails (error handling).
Content Negotiation: No tests for Accept header variations or unsupported media types (e.g., Accept: text/plain -> 406).
Conditional & Partial Responses: No tests for partial responses (e.g., fields filtering) or presence/absence of audit fields when audit param omitted (default behavior verification).
Rate/Load spike safety: While heavy load and large results are covered, there is no test for graceful degradation (timeouts, circuit-breaker behaviors).
recommendations: Add pagination tests that verify server behavior with large tag sets: page/limit params (if supported), correct slicing, total counts, and pagination-related response headers.
Introduce caching tests: verify ETag and Cache-Control headers, conditional GET handling (If-None-Match leading to 304), and behavior after tag changes (cache invalidation).
Add rate-limiting tests that generate burst traffic and assert proper responses (429) and Retry-After headers if applicable.
Add authorization-negative tests for forbidden access (403) when an authenticated user lacks permission to view tags.
Add strict Tag schema validation tests to assert required fields, types, and response contract stability for each returned Tag object.
Add negative plugin-related tests: pluginProperty when plugin is unavailable or not supported, malformed pluginProperty values, and verify appropriate error handling and messages.
Add content-negotiation tests (Accept header variations) and verify 406 or proper fallback to application/json.
Verify default audit behavior when audit param is omitted (should default to NONE) and add tests for MINIMAL vs NONE differences at the field level.
Add chaos / degradation tests for load spikes and timeout behavior (e.g., ensure timeouts return 504 or client-side retry guidance).
